Uses of Package
graphpack.extensions

Packages that use graphpack.extensions
graphpack common GraphPack classes
the most important classes are GraphPackService, which manages a GraphPack service and GraphPackClient, which represents a client that can connect to GraphPack services 
graphpack.extensions contains extensions which can be used statically and dynamically by tasks 
graphpack.local local service, client and node abstractions (bridge design pattern) 
graphpack.taskprocessing contains interfaces for task processing facilities
 
graphpack.taskprocessing.quartz contains a concrete Quartz implementation of ITaskManager
 
 

Classes in graphpack.extensions used by graphpack
Extensions
          a collection of extension objects that may be passed to running tasks
 

Classes in graphpack.extensions used by graphpack.extensions
Extension
          this interface should be sub-classed by extension providers
it allows for an extension to provide an extended version of a currently processed node
this extension should be security aware (otherwise it could just be a static method)
 

Classes in graphpack.extensions used by graphpack.local
Extensions
          a collection of extension objects that may be passed to running tasks
 

Classes in graphpack.extensions used by graphpack.taskprocessing
Extensions
          a collection of extension objects that may be passed to running tasks
 

Classes in graphpack.extensions used by graphpack.taskprocessing.quartz
Extensions
          a collection of extension objects that may be passed to running tasks
